IRS Code 977 Meaning

IRS Code 977 means an amended return was filed/posted to the account (commonly a Form 1040-X). This page explains what it signals, what it does not confirm, and how to summarize the timeline in plain English for clients. Want to see what clients get? Open the sample report, then run your own transcript when you’re ready.

Try the parser (requires credits)

What is IRS Code 977?

Plain-English definition: IRS Code 977 indicates an amended return was filed/posted to the module. Think of it as “the amendment is in the system,” not “the amendment is finished.”

Client-friendly summary
"Your amended return was received and added to your account"
Common transcript type
Account Transcript
Typical context
Amended return processing pipeline
Usually appears near
Codes 150, 290, 971

What Code 977 does (and doesn’t) tell you

What it tells you

  • Amended return recorded: The amendment was received/posted to the account.
  • Timeline anchor: The posting date is a reliable “start point” for transcript-based tracking.
  • Watch-for setup: You can now monitor for adjustments, holds, notices, refunds, or balances.

What it does not tell you

  • Approval: 977 does not confirm the amendment was accepted as filed.
  • Completion: 977 does not mean processing is complete.
  • Outcome: 977 does not confirm refund, balance due, or net change.

What usually happens next

After 977, the transcript may show follow-on activity. The point is to narrate sequence, not vibes.

  • Adjusted assessment: A later adjustment/assessment entry (often Code 290) may post if the amendment changes tax due or credits.
  • Notice/action: A notice/action entry (often Code 971) may appear to document correspondence or processing steps.
  • Original baseline: The original assessment (often Code 150) helps you compare “before vs after.”

What should a tax professional do next?

  1. Balance: Compare the module balance before and after the 977 posting date.
  2. Context: Tie the amendment to the client’s stated goal (refund increase, credit claim, correction, etc.).
  3. Dates: Capture posting dates for 150/971/290 around 977 to explain the sequence.
  4. Message: Summarize “received/posted” vs “processed/completed” so the client doesn’t assume it’s done.

Example: how this looks in a parsed report

Below is a simplified view of how Code 977 can appear in a client-ready transcript report with context:

Amended Return Timeline (Simplified)
Code 150 – Return filed and assessed (baseline)
Date: 04/15/2024
Code 977 – Amended return filed/posted
Date: 08/02/2024
Code 290 – Additional tax assessed / adjustment posted
Note: Amount/date determine the net result

FAQ

What does IRS Code 977 mean on a tax transcript?

IRS Code 977 generally means an amended return was filed/posted to the account. It indicates the amendment is on the module, not that it has been fully processed or approved.

Does IRS Code 977 mean the amended return is finished?

No. Code 977 indicates the amended return is recorded. Processing can still be pending. Confirm by reviewing later adjustments, balance changes, and related notices.

Why does Code 977 often show up with Code 971?

Code 971 commonly reflects a notice or action on the account, and it often appears around amended return activity to document related communications or processing steps.
